Event: My girlfriend of 2 years ended our relationship by cheating on me, followed by moving out with all of our stuff and saying she never even loved me, leading me on. It has been 6 months since the breakup but feels like it's only been a week, causing philosophical questioning about life and motivation.
Post: "Feeling like a mere pawn in the game of love, I'm left grappling with the harsh reality of betrayal. My girlfriend of 2 years has moved on, taking everything with her, leaving me heartbroken and questioning my worth. Maybe it's me, maybe I'll never be worthy of love."

Event: Being admitted to a hospital for mental health issues.
Post: "I've been admitted to the hospital for my mental health issues, and I can't help but wonder if it's because of my own failures and shortcomings. Maybe I'm just not strong enough to handle life's challenges."

Event: Mom's odd way of expressing love and nurturing, struggles with eating disorder, and passive-aggressive behavior towards the person.
Post: "I'll never forget the time my mom expressed her 'love' by forcing me to eat an entire pizza by myself. She claimed it was because she wanted me to be 'big and strong,' but I knew it was just her passive-aggressive way of dealing with her own eating disorder. Now, every time I see a pizza, I can't help but feel a mix of shame and resentment. Maybe it's me, maybe I'll never be able to have a healthy relationship with food or my mom."

I'm starting to question everything I thought I knew about myself and my purpose in life."

Maybe it's just me, maybe I'll always be alone." #IAS #depression #loneliness
